txt.en:
'As I am sure others have told you by now, Khazad-dûm holds many secrets beyond what the eye can see itself. One of those secrets is held behind a hidden door to the north-east of here.

'It is an ancient crystal-mine, Kheled-menem, a place we used to gather up the glowing crystals you see throughout our camps. If we are to bring Khazad-dûm back to its glory, we will need this mine.

'I have much to do inside this place; however, I will not trust you with helping me until you can find the door yourself. We dwarves do not give up Khazad-dûm's secrets easily, but I will provide you with a little help. Head north-east, beyond the Orc-watch and the Ghâsh-hai encampments, but do not venture near the Orcs beyond. With the purple dwarf-lamp you built, the door to Kheled-menem should now reveal itself to you. Make sure you check places you might have looked past with haste before.'
'So, you found the entrance to Kheled-menem. The doors have been known to be difficult...sometimes they do not even show themselves to dwarves. I am impressed you were able to find it.'
'You must find the door yourself in order to gain entrance.'
After finding several purple dwarf-lamp fragments, Gúthi combined them into a functioning purple dwarf-lamp.

Endrith indicated that the door to Kheled-menem was north-east of Anazârmekhem, saying it was beyond the Orc-watch and the Ghâsh-hai encampments, but before the other Orc-camps.\n\nEndrith told you of a crystal-mine hidden behind an ancient door, saying that your purple dwarf-lamp would now reveal the door to you. He was, however, cryptic about where to find this door.
Endrith is at Anazârmekhem, south-west of Kheled-menem.\n\nEndrith will be pleased to hear you met his challenge and found the entrance to Kheled-menem.
